abstract: Prices will rise with health care reform, since there will be more people seeking care from the same limited number of doctors and nurses, two economists write, suggesting ways to fix the problem.
snippet: Prices will rise with health care reform, since there will be more people seeking care from the same limited number of doctors and nurses, two economists write, suggesting ways to fix the problem.
lead_paragraph: Aaron Edlin is a law and economics professor at the University of California, Berkeley. Dana Goldman is a pharmacy and public policy professor and the director of the Leonard D. Schaeffer Center for Health Policy and Economics at the University of Southern California.

headline.main: Can Immigrants Solve Our Health Care Problems?

byline.original: By Aaron Edlin and Dana P. Goldman
